p:
Given the ubiquity of symptoms and the uncertain incubation period, both of which are nearly indistinguishable from illnesses ranging from the common cold to seasonal flu to malaria and EVD, it is understandably difficult to identify the presence of H5N1 based merely on external signs in any given patient. 11 Further complicating matters is the fact that
The majority of human infections with Asian HPAI H5N1 have occurred among children and adults younger than 40 years old. Mortality has been highest in people aged 10â€“19 years old and in young adults. 12
